data.question: What is the stoichiometry of the compounds formed by the reduction of specifically preoriented bisdiazenes by alkali metals?
How many electrons are cyclically delocalized in the plane made up by the four nitrogen atoms in the reduced bisdiazenes?
What is the structural motif of the core unit in the solid-state structure of the sodium compound of 12(cid:1)?
What causes the difference between the two transannular N(cid:1)N distances in the precursor 1?
data.answer: The interaction between the methyl group and the hydrogen atoms on C3 and C9 in anti position

data.question: What is the symmetry of the dianion 12(cid:1) in solution as indicated by 1H NMR spectra?
What does the splitting of the 1H NMR signals of the a-hydrogen atoms and the methyl group into two resonances upon cooling to (cid:1)30 8C indicate?
data.answer: A fluxional process, whereby the dimer with the methyl groups in anti position interconverts with the corresponding syn conformer

data.question: Why were single crystals of pure [Na2(1)(THF/DME)x]y not obtained by reduction of 1 on a sodium mirror in THF or DME?
data.answer: However, crystals suitable for a X-ray structure analysis were obtained as a 2:1 mixture of [Na2(1)] and bishydrazine 2[1c] from a THF solution kept in contact with sodium metal for several weeks.

data.question: What is the likely proton source for the formation of bishydrazine 2 by a Birch-type reduction of 1?
What does the molecular volume calculated from the diffusion coefficient indicate about the structure of [Na4(1)2(THF)x] in solution?
data.answer: It is close to the estimated volume of the [Na4(1)2] cluster in the chain polymer [Na4(1)2(2)(THF)4]¥, indicating this cluster is also present in solution.

data.question: What is the role of the bishydrazine 2 as ligand in the structure of [Na4(1)2(THF)x] in solution?
data.answer: It is replaced by THF, that is, [Na4(1)2-(THF)x] (x = 4–6).

data.question: What does the presence of a fluxional process in the dianion 12(cid:1) indicate about its structure?
data.answer: It suggests that the structure can dynamically change between different conformers.

data.question: What does the calculated strongly negative nucleus independent chemical shift (NICS) of (cid:1)18.4 ppm at the N4 ring centroid suggest about the model structure [Na4(1)F2]?
data.answer: It suggests that the model structure [Na4(1)F2] is a bishomoaromatic system.

data.question: Is the S0 singlet state for the counterion-free dianions stable with respect to the T0 triplet states?
Are the N=N bonds in the reduced bisdiazenes shorter than in the precursor 1?
Is the molecular volume of [Na4(1)2(THF)x] in solution significantly different from that of the [Na4(1)2] cluster in the chain polymer [Na4(1)2(2)(THF)4]¥?
Does the dianion 12(cid:1) exhibit Cs symmetry in both solid-state and solution?
Is the core of the [Na4(1)2] unit a distorted Na4N8 cuboctahedron in both the solid state and solution?
Does the transannular N(cid:1)N bond path show characteristics of typical shared and closed-shell interactions?
Are the electron populations of the four nitrogen atomic basins exactly the same?
Is the dimer with the methyl groups in anti position the only conformer present at low temperatures?
